getPreferenceValue

public java.lang.String getPreferenceValue(java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.String defaultValue)
look up a preference value.

will return user settings if available or default settings if not. If a system property with the given key is defined it will overrule any existing setting in the preference store. if the key is not defined, this method returns the given default..

Parameters:
key -
Returns:
the value or specified default if no such key exists..

getPrologInterface

public PrologInterface getPrologInterface(java.lang.String key)
get a PrologInterface to a given key. This is a convenience method to "just get the darn thing". This will use create the PrologInterface if the registry does not contain it, and register it with the registry. No subscription will be added to the history.

Parameters:
key -
Returns:
Throws:
PrologInterfaceException

getPrologInterface

public PrologInterface getPrologInterface(Subscription s)
Subscribe to a PrologInterface. If the registry does not contain a pif for key the subscription is for, this method will create a new pif and register it with the registry.

Parameters:
s - The subscription to use. If a subscription with the same id exists, it is replaced. Must not be null.
Returns:
the ProlotInterface instance, either from registry, or freshly created.
Throws:
PrologInterfaceException

getPrologInterfaceRegistry

public PrologInterfaceRegistry getPrologInterfaceRegistry()

hasPrologInterface

public boolean hasPrologInterface(java.lang.String pifKey)
Checks if a PrologInterface is registered for the given key. This method may be used by clients who want to check for the existence of a key in the registry without actualy creating a PrologInterface (yet). This is aequivalent to calling getPrologInterfaceRegistry().getRegisteredKeys().contains(pifKey)

Parameters:
pifKey -
Returns:
